text: Flavio Roman Alfaro (October 26, 1961January 27, 2021) was an American baseball shortstop and second baseman. He played one season of Minor League Baseball. He was known for being a member of the U.S. baseball team at the 1984 Summer Olympics that won a silver medal. Alfaro was born in Los Angeles. Alfaro died on January 27, 2021 from pancreatic cancer, aged 59. ==References== Category:1961 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:American basketball players Category:Sportspeople from Los Angeles
title: Flavio Alfaro
